content_parts.title: Source document links on the Integrations page

content_parts.content:
The integration page has been enhanced to provide a more user-friendly experience. This improvement streamlines navigation by introducing key features:

  • Clicking on the key link directs users to the associated record. Upon closing the record page, users are automatically redirected back to the integration page.
  • A secondary link is now available for the source document when associated with a finance line. This additional link offers convenient access to relevant details.

Important Note: The secondary link is applicable only to new finance documents. It is not retroactively provided for documents created before the implementation of this new feature.

content_parts.content:
The proforma invoice feature is a now available.

This improvement is designed to streamline your invoicing process, offering an improved overall user experience.

  • Prior to the shipment of goods and services, it offers a preview of expected billing.
  • Users can effortlessly generate proforma invoices directly from the sales orders.
  • The proforma report relies on the template designer tool, simplifying customization.
  • An extra tab containing relevant details of pro forma invoices has been incorporated into the sales order page

Please be aware that the sending action for the proforma invoice remains outside the scope of this release.

content_parts.content:
For users leveraging a Sage Intacct integration, we now provide the option to send the SDMO finance transactions as "Top level" or "Entity level" for AP Bill, AR Invoice or Journals in Sage Intacct. The new option of sending SDMO transactions at an 'Entity level' allows your business to maintain the multi-level entity structure already established in Sage Intacct. 

The transaction integration level is defined on the new tab 'Defaults' of the Sage Intacct configuration page. By default, it is set to 'Top level'.
